tool.name: tool_23

param.name: SLOPE_MIN
param.dialogReference:
Slope Minimum

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Default: 0.000000

Assume a given minimum slope for each cell.

param.name: SLOPE_MAX
param.dialogReference:
Slope Threshold

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Maximum: 90.000000

Default: 5.000000

Slope threshold, given as degree, above which flow transport is unlimited.

param.name: T_FLOW_MIN
param.dialogReference:
Minimum

Floating point

Minimum: 1.000000

Default: 1.000000

Flow threshold, given as amount of cells, above which flow transport is unlimited. Ignored if range equals zero.

param.name: T_FLOW_MAX
param.dialogReference:
Maximum

Floating point

Minimum: 1.000000

Default: 100.000000

Flow threshold, given as amount of cells, above which flow transport is unlimited. Ignored if range equals zero.

tool.summary: Flow accumulation is calculated as upslope contributing (catchment) area using the multiple flow direction approach of Freeman (1991). For this tool the approach has been modified to limit the flow portion routed through a cell depending on the local slope. If a cell is not inclined, no flow is routed through it at all. With increasing slopes the portion of flow routed through a cell becomes higher. Cells with slopes greater than a specified slope threshold route their entire accumulated flow downhill.

(2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015.
